org.opengrok.indexer.util

Class SourceSplitter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opengrok.indexer.util.SourceSplitter

  • public class SourceSplitter
extends Object
    Represents a splitter of source text into lines where end-of-line tokens -- identified by StringUtils.STANDARD_EOL -- are maintained instead of being stripped.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SourceSplitter() 

    • Method Summary

      int count()
      Gets the number of split lines.

      Gets the lines at the specified offset.
      int getPosition(int offset)
      Gets the starting document character position of the line at the specified offset.
      int originalLength()
      Gets the number of characters in the original source document.
      void reset(StreamSource src)
      Calls reset(org.opengrok.indexer.analysis.StreamSource, org.opengrok.indexer.util.ReaderWrapper) with src and null.
      void reset(StreamSource src, ReaderWrapper wrapper)
      Reset the splitter to use the specified inputs.
      void reset(String original)
      Reset the splitter to use the specified content.

      • getPosition

        public int getPosition(int offset)
        Gets the starting document character position of the line at the specified offset.
        Parameters:
        offset - greater than or equal to zero and less than or equal to count()
        Returns:
        line length, including the end-of-line token
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if offset is out of bounds

      • findLineOffset

        public int findLineOffset(int position)
        Find the line offset for the specified document position.
        Parameters:
        position - greater than or equal to zero and less than originalLength().
        Returns:
        -1 if position is beyond the document bounds; otherwise, a valid offset
